refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GstGLWindow represents a window that elements can render into. A window can either be a user visible window (onscreen) or hidden (offscreen).

refsect2.title: GstGLWindowResizeCB ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*GstGLWindowResizeCB) (gpointer data, guint width, guint height);

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GstGLWindow using display 's connection.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_draw ()
refsect2.para: Redraw the window contents. Implementations should invoke the draw callback.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_run ()
refsect2.para: Start the execution of the runloop.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstGLContext associated with this window .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the windowing system display handle for this window

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_send_message ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_send_message (GstGLWindow *window, GstGLWindowCB callback, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Invoke callback with data on the window thread. callback is guarenteed to have executed when this function returns.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_send_message_async ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_send_message_async (GstGLWindow *window, GstGLWindowCB callback, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Invoke callback with data on the window thread. The callback may not have been executed when this function returns.

entry.para: called when data is not needed anymore

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_set_close_callback ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_set_close_callback (GstGLWindow *window, GstGLWindowCB callback, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy_notify);
refsect2.para: Sets the callback called when the window is about to close.

entry.para: called when data is not needed any more

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_set_draw_callback ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_set_draw_callback (GstGLWindow *window, GstGLWindowCB callback, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy_notify);
refsect2.para: Sets the draw callback called everytime gst_gl_window_draw() is called

entry.para: called when data is not needed any more

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_set_resize_callback ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_set_resize_callback (GstGLWindow *window, GstGLWindowResizeCB callback, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy_notify);
refsect2.para: Sets the resize callback called everytime a resize of the window occurs.

entry.para: called when data is not needed any more

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_set_window_handle ()
refsect2.para: Sets the window that this window should render into. Some implementations require this to be called with a valid handle before drawing can commence.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the window handle we are currently rendering into

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_set_preferred_size ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_set_preferred_size (GstGLWindow *window, gint width, gint height);
refsect2.para: Set the preferred width and height of the window. Implementations are free to ignore this information.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_show ()
refsect2.para: Present the window to the screen.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_handle_events ()
refsect2.para: Tell a window that it should handle events from the window system. These events are forwarded upstream as navigation events. In some window systems events are not propagated in the window hierarchy if a client is listening for them. This method allows you to disable events handling completely from the window .

entry.para: a gboolean indicating if events should be handled or not.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_resize ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_window_resize (GstGLWindow *window, guint width, guint height);

refsect2.title: gst_gl_window_set_render_rectangle ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gst_gl_window_set_render_rectangle (GstGLWindow *window, gint x, gint y, gint width, gint height);
refsect2.para: Tell a window that it should render into a specific region of the window according to the GstVideoOverlay interface.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: whether the specified region could be set

refsect2.title: GstGLWindow
refsect2.para: GstGLWindow is an opaque struct and should only be accessed through the provided api.
